intro: Antidesma bangueyense, commonly known as the Bangueyense antidesma, is a shrub or small tree native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes a wide range of plants with diverse morphological features. The plant typically has simple, opposite leaves that are often elliptical or ovate in shape. Its flowers are small and clustered, with both male and female flowers present on the same plant. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release seeds, contributing to its dispersal in the natural habitat.
